senses.sense_definition: Abbreviation of <w>pennyweight</w>, a unit of mass equal to 24 grains or one twentieth of a troy ounce.

examples.text: The antique gold chain weighs approximately fifteen <w>dwt</w>.
Jewelers often use <w>dwt</w> to measure the weight of precious metals.

senses.sense_definition: Abbreviation of deadweight tonnage, a measure of how much weight a ship can carry.

examples.text: The new oil tanker has a capacity of 50,000 <w>dwt</w>.
Shipping companies calculate fees based on the vessel's <w>dwt</w>.

senses.sense_definition: Initialism of discrete wavelet transform, a mathematical method used in signal processing and data compression.

examples.text: The engineer applied a <w>dwt</w> to analyze the signal frequencies.
Image compression algorithms often utilize <w>dwt</w> for better efficiency.
